Typedef Documentation

◆ centity_t

typedef struct centity_s centity_t

centity_t have a direct corespondence with gentity_t in the game, but only the entityState_t is directly communicated to the cgame.

◆ localEntity_t

822 {

824 
825  // walk the list backwards, so any new local entities generated
826  // (trails, marks, etc) will be present this frame
827  le = cg_activeLocalEntities.prev;
828  for (; le != &cg_activeLocalEntities; le = next) {
829  // grab next now, so if the local entity is freed we
830  // still have it
831  next = le->prev;
832 
833  if (cg.time >= le->endTime) {

835  continue;
836  }

838  default:

843  break;
844

847  break;

851  break;

238 {
239  int j;
240  markPoly_t* mp, * next;

242  int fade;
243 
244  if (!cg_addMarks.integer) {
245  return;
246  }
247 
248  mp = cg_activeMarkPolys.nextMark;

250  // grab next now, so if the local entity is freed we
251  // still have it
252  next = mp->nextMark;
253 
254  // see if it is time to completely remove it
255  if (cg.time > mp->time + MARK_TOTAL_TIME) {
256  CG_FreeMarkPoly(mp);
257  continue;
258  }
259 
260  // fade out the energy bursts
261  if (mp->markShader == cgs.media.energyMarkShader) {
262 
263  fade = 450 - 450 * ((cg.time - mp->time) / 3000.0);
264  if (fade < 255) {
265  if (fade < 0) {
266  fade = 0;
267  }
268  if (mp->verts[0].modulate[0] != 0) {
269  for (j = 0; j < mp->poly.numVerts; j++) {
270  mp->verts[j].modulate[0] = mp->color[0] * fade;
271  mp->verts[j].modulate[1] = mp->color[1] * fade;
272  mp->verts[j].modulate[2] = mp->color[2] * fade;
273  }
274  }
275  }
276  }
277 
278  // fade all marks out with time
279  t = mp->time + MARK_TOTAL_TIME - cg.time;
280  if (t < MARK_FADE_TIME) {
281  fade = 255 * t / MARK_FADE_TIME;
282  if (mp->alphaFade) {
283  for (j = 0; j < mp->poly.numVerts; j++) {
284  mp->verts[j].modulate[3] = fade;
285  }
286  } else {
287  for (j = 0; j < mp->poly.numVerts; j++) {
288  mp->verts[j].modulate[0] = mp->color[0] * fade;
289  mp->verts[j].modulate[1] = mp->color[1] * fade;
290  mp->verts[j].modulate[2] = mp->color[2] * fade;
291  }
292  }
293  }
294 
295 
296  trap_R_AddPolyToScene(mp->markShader, mp->poly.numVerts, mp->verts);
297  }
298 }

1062  if (cg.nextSnap) {
1063  int delta;
1064 
1065  delta = (cg.nextSnap->serverTime - cg.snap->serverTime);
1066  if (delta == 0) {
1067  cg.frameInterpolation = 0;
1068  } else {
1069  cg.frameInterpolation = (float)(cg.time - cg.snap->serverTime) / delta;
1070  }
1071  } else {
1072  cg.frameInterpolation = 0; // actually, it should never be used, because
1073  // no entities should be marked as interpolating
1074  }
1075

1083  cg.autoAnglesFast[2] = 0;

◆ CG_AddParticles()

void CG_AddParticles ( void  )

Definition at line 805 of file cg_particles.c.

806 {
807  cparticle_t* p, * next;
808  float alpha;
809  float time, time2;
810  vec3_t org;
811  cparticle_t* active, * tail;
812  vec3_t rotate_ang;
813 
814  if (!initparticles)
815  CG_ClearParticles();
816 
817  VectorCopy(cg.refdef.viewaxis[0], vforward);
818  VectorCopy(cg.refdef.viewaxis[1], vright);
819  VectorCopy(cg.refdef.viewaxis[2], vup);
820 
821  vectoangles(cg.refdef.viewaxis[0], rotate_ang);
822  roll += ((cg.time - oldtime) * 0.1);
823  rotate_ang[ROLL] += (roll * 0.9);
824  AngleVectors(rotate_ang, rforward, rright, rup);
825 
826  oldtime = cg.time;
827 
828  active = NULL;
829  tail = NULL;
830 
831  for (p = active_particles; p; p = next) {
832 
833  next = p->next;
834 
835  time = (cg.time - p->time) * 0.001;
836 
837  alpha = p->alpha + time * p->alphavel;
838  if (alpha <= 0) { // faded out
839  p->next = free_particles;
840  free_particles = p;
841  p->type = 0;
842  p->color = 0;
843  p->alpha = 0;
844  continue;
845  }
846 
847  if (p->type == P_SMOKE || p->type == P_ANIM || p->type == P_BLEED || p->type == P_SMOKE_IMPACT) {
848  if (cg.time > p->endtime) {
849  p->next = free_particles;
850  free_particles = p;
851  p->type = 0;
852  p->color = 0;
853  p->alpha = 0;
854 
855  continue;
856  }
857 
858  }
859 
860  if (p->type == P_WEATHER_FLURRY) {
861  if (cg.time > p->endtime) {
862  p->next = free_particles;
863  free_particles = p;
864  p->type = 0;
865  p->color = 0;
866  p->alpha = 0;
867 
868  continue;
869  }
870  }
871 
872 
873  if (p->type == P_FLAT_SCALEUP_FADE) {
874  if (cg.time > p->endtime) {
875  p->next = free_particles;
876  free_particles = p;
877  p->type = 0;
878  p->color = 0;
879  p->alpha = 0;
880  continue;
881  }
882 
883  }
884 
885  if ((p->type == P_BAT || p->type == P_SPRITE) && p->endtime < 0) {
886  // temporary sprite
887  CG_AddParticleToScene(p, p->org, alpha);
888  p->next = free_particles;
889  free_particles = p;
890  p->type = 0;
891  p->color = 0;
892  p->alpha = 0;
893  continue;
894  }
895 
896  p->next = NULL;
897  if (!tail)
898  active = tail = p;
899  else {
900  tail->next = p;
901  tail = p;
902  }
903 
904  if (alpha > 1.0)
905  alpha = 1;
906 
907  time2 = time * time;
908 
909  org[0] = p->org[0] + p->vel[0] * time + p->accel[0] * time2;
910  org[1] = p->org[1] + p->vel[1] * time + p->accel[1] * time2;
911  org[2] = p->org[2] + p->vel[2] * time + p->accel[2] * time2;
912 
913  CG_AddParticleToScene(p, org, alpha);
914  }
915 
916  active_particles = active;
917 }

◆ CG_AddPlayerWeapon()

void CG_AddPlayerWeapon ( refEntity_t *  parent,
playerState_t *  ps,
centity_t *  cent,
int  team 
)

Used for both the view weapon (ps is valid) and the world modelother character models (ps is NULL).

The main player will have this called for BOTH cases, so effects like light and sound should only be done on the world model case.

Parameters
parent
ps
cent
team

1234  if (weaponNum == WP_RAILGUN) {
1235  clientInfo_t* ci = &cgs.clientinfo[cent->currentState.clientNum];

1237  int scale = 255 * (cg.time - cent->pe.railFireTime) / 1500;

1239  gun.shaderRGBA[1] = (ci->c1RGBA[1] * scale) >> 8;
1240  gun.shaderRGBA[2] = (ci->c1RGBA[2] * scale) >> 8;
1241  gun.shaderRGBA[3] = 255;
1242  } else {
1243  Byte4Copy(ci->c1RGBA, gun.shaderRGBA);
1244  }
1245  }
1246

1248  if (!gun.hModel) {

1250  }

52 
53  cg_numSolidEntities = 0;
54  cg_numTriggerEntities = 0;
55 
56  if (cg.nextSnap && !cg.nextFrameTeleport && !cg.thisFrameTeleport) {
57  snap = cg.nextSnap;
58  } else {
59  snap = cg.snap;
60  }
61 
62  for (i = 0; i < snap->numEntities; i++) {
63  cent = &cg_entities[snap->entities[i].number];
64  ent = &cent->currentState;
65 
66  if (ent->eType == ET_ITEM || ent->eType == ET_PUSH_TRIGGER || ent->eType == ET_TELEPORT_TRIGGER) {
67  cg_triggerEntities[cg_numTriggerEntities] = cent;
68  cg_numTriggerEntities++;
69  continue;
70  }
71 
72  if (cent->nextState.solid) {
73  cg_solidEntities[cg_numSolidEntities] = cent;
74  cg_numSolidEntities++;
75  continue;
76  }
77  }
78 }

878  } else {

881  cg_timescale.value = cg_timescaleFadeEnd.value;

885  }
886  }

◆ CG_DrawFlagModel()

void CG_DrawFlagModel ( float  x,

)

Definition at line 365 of file cg_draw.c.

366 {
367  qhandle_t cm;
368  float len;
369  vec3_t origin, angles;
370  vec3_t mins, maxs;
371  qhandle_t handle;
372 
373  if (!force2D && cg_draw3dIcons.integer) {
374 
375  VectorClear(angles);
376 
377  cm = cgs.media.redFlagModel;
378 
379  // offset the origin y and z to center the flag
380  trap_R_ModelBounds(cm, mins, maxs);
381 
382  origin[2] = -0.5 * (mins[2] + maxs[2]);
383  origin[1] = 0.5 * (mins[1] + maxs[1]);
384 
385  // calculate distance so the flag nearly fills the box
386  // assume heads are taller than wide
387  len = 0.5 * (maxs[2] - mins[2]);
388  origin[0] = len / 0.268; // len / tan( fov/2 )
389 
390  angles[YAW] = 60 * sin(cg.time / 2000.0);;
391 
392  if (team == TEAM_RED) {
393  handle = cgs.media.redFlagModel;
394  } else if (team == TEAM_BLUE) {
395  handle = cgs.media.blueFlagModel;
396  } else if (team == TEAM_FREE) {
397  handle = cgs.media.neutralFlagModel;
398  } else {
399  return;
400  }
401  CG_Draw3DModel(x, y, w, h, handle, 0, origin, angles);
402  } else if (cg_drawIcons.integer) {
403  gitem_t* item;
404 
405  if (team == TEAM_RED) {
406  item = BG_FindItemForPowerup(PW_REDFLAG);
407  } else if (team == TEAM_BLUE) {
408  item = BG_FindItemForPowerup(PW_BLUEFLAG);
409  } else if (team == TEAM_FREE) {
410  item = BG_FindItemForPowerup(PW_NEUTRALFLAG);
411  } else {
412  return;
413  }
414  if (item) {
415  CG_DrawPic(x, y, w, h, cg_items[ITEM_INDEX(item)].icon);
416  }
417  }
418 }

318 {
319  clipHandle_t cm;
320  clientInfo_t* ci;
321  float len;
322  vec3_t origin;
323  vec3_t mins, maxs;
324 
325  ci = &cgs.clientinfo[clientNum];
326 
327  if (cg_draw3dIcons.integer) {
328  cm = ci->headModel;
329  if (!cm) {
330  return;
331  }
332 
333  // offset the origin y and z to center the head
334  trap_R_ModelBounds(cm, mins, maxs);
335 
336  origin[2] = -0.5 * (mins[2] + maxs[2]);
337  origin[1] = 0.5 * (mins[1] + maxs[1]);
338 
339  // calculate distance so the head nearly fills the box
340  // assume heads are taller than wide
341  len = 0.7 * (maxs[2] - mins[2]);
342  origin[0] = len / 0.268; // len / tan( fov/2 )
343 
344  // allow per-model tweaking
345  VectorAdd(origin, ci->headOffset, origin);
346 
347  CG_Draw3DModel(x, y, w, h, ci->headModel, ci->headSkin, origin, headAngles);
348  } else if (cg_drawIcons.integer) {
349  CG_DrawPic(x, y, w, h, ci->modelIcon);
350  }
351

354  CG_DrawPic(x, y, w, h, cgs.media.deferShader);
355  }
356 }

285  }

298  return qfalse;
299  }

323  }
324  } else {

327  } else if (cg.teamScores[0] >= cg.teamScores[1]) {
328  s = va("Red leads %i to %i", cg.teamScores[0], cg.teamScores[1]);
329  } else {

373  y += (n1 * lineHeight) + BIGCHAR_HEIGHT;
374  maxClients -= n1;
375  n2 = CG_TeamScoreboard(y, TEAM_BLUE, fade, maxClients, lineHeight);

384  n2 = CG_TeamScoreboard(y, TEAM_RED, fade, maxClients, lineHeight);

388  }

393  //
394  // free for all scoreboard
395  //

399  y += (n2 * lineHeight) + BIGCHAR_HEIGHT;
400  }

405  if (cg.scores[i].client == cg.snap->ps.clientNum) {
406  CG_DrawClientScore(y, &cg.scores[i], fadeColor, fade, lineHeight == SB_NORMAL_HEIGHT);
407  break;
408  }
409  }
410  }
411 
412  // load any models that have been deferred
413  if (++cg.deferredPlayerLoading > 10) {
414  CG_LoadDeferredPlayers();
415  }
416 
417  return qtrue;
418 }

173 {
174  vec4_t color;
175  const char* s;
176  int xx;
177  int cnt;
178 
179  if (maxChars <= 0)
180  maxChars = 32767; // do them all!
181 
182  // draw the drop shadow
183  if (shadow) {
184  color[0] = color[1] = color[2] = 0;
185  color[3] = setColor[3];
186  trap_R_SetColor(color);
187  s = string;
188  xx = x;
189  cnt = 0;
190  while (*s && cnt < maxChars) {
191  if (Q_IsColorString(s)) {
192  s += 2;
193  continue;
194  }
195  CG_DrawChar(xx + 2, y + 2, charWidth, charHeight, *s);
196  cnt++;
197  xx += charWidth;
198  s++;
199  }
200  }
201 
202  // draw the colored text
203  s = string;
204  xx = x;
205  cnt = 0;
206  trap_R_SetColor(setColor);
207  while (*s && cnt < maxChars) {
208  if (Q_IsColorString(s)) {
209  if (!forceColor) {
210  memcpy(color, g_color_table[ColorIndex(*(s + 1))], sizeof(color));
211  color[3] = setColor[3];
212  trap_R_SetColor(color);
213  }
214  s += 2;
215  continue;
216  }
217  CG_DrawChar(xx, y, charWidth, charHeight, *s);
218  xx += charWidth;
219  cnt++;
220  s++;
221  }
222  trap_R_SetColor(NULL);
223 }

462  }

505  y += 64;
506 
507  CG_DrawStringExt(8, y, "Blue Team", color, qtrue, qtrue, GIANT_WIDTH, GIANT_HEIGHT, 0);
508  s = va("%i", cg.teamScores[1]);
509  CG_DrawStringExt(632 - GIANT_WIDTH * strlen(s), y, s, color, qtrue, qtrue, GIANT_WIDTH, GIANT_HEIGHT, 0);
510  } else {
511  //
512  // free for all scoreboard
513  //
514  for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
515  ci = &cgs.clientinfo[i];
516  if (!ci->infoValid) {
517  continue;
518  }
519  if (ci->team != TEAM_FREE) {
520  continue;
521  }
522 
523  CG_DrawStringExt(8, y, ci->name, color, qtrue, qtrue, GIANT_WIDTH, GIANT_HEIGHT, 0);
524  s = va("%i", ci->score);
525  CG_DrawStringExt(632 - GIANT_WIDTH * strlen(s), y, s, color, qtrue, qtrue, GIANT_WIDTH, GIANT_HEIGHT, 0);
526  y += 64;
527  }
528  }
529 
530 
531 }

◆ CG_DrawWeaponSelect()

void CG_DrawWeaponSelect ( void  )

Definition at line 1465 of file cg_weapons.c.

1466 {
1467  int i;
1468  int bits;
1469  int count;
1470  int x, y, w;
1471  char* name;
1472  float* color;
1473 
1474  // don't display if dead
1475  if (cg.predictedPlayerState.stats[STAT_HEALTH] <= 0) {
1476  return;
1477  }
1478 
1479  color = CG_FadeColor(cg.weaponSelectTime, WEAPON_SELECT_TIME);
1480  if (!color) {
1481  return;
1482  }
1483  trap_R_SetColor(color);
1484 
1485  // showing weapon select clears pickup item display, but not the blend blob
1486  cg.itemPickupTime = 0;
1487 
1488  // count the number of weapons owned
1489  bits = cg.snap->ps.stats[STAT_WEAPONS];
1490  count = 0;
1491  for (i = 1; i < MAX_WEAPONS; i++) {
1492  if (bits & (1 << i)) {
1493  count++;
1494  }
1495  }
1496 
1497  x = 320 - count * 20;
1498  y = 380;
1499 
1500  for (i = 1; i < MAX_WEAPONS; i++) {
1501  if (!(bits & (1 << i))) {
1502  continue;
1503  }
1504 
1505  CG_RegisterWeapon(i);
1506 
1507  // draw weapon icon
1508  CG_DrawPic(x, y, 32, 32, cg_weapons[i].weaponIcon);
1509 
1510  // draw selection marker
1511  if (i == cg.weaponSelect) {
1512  CG_DrawPic(x - 4, y - 4, 40, 40, cgs.media.selectShader);
1513  }
1514 
1515  // no ammo cross on top
1516  if (!cg.snap->ps.ammo[i]) {
1517  CG_DrawPic(x, y, 32, 32, cgs.media.noammoShader);
1518  }
1519 
1520  x += 40;
1521  }
1522 
1523  // draw the selected name
1524  if (cg_weapons[cg.weaponSelect].item) {
1525  name = cg_weapons[cg.weaponSelect].item->pickup_name;
1526  if (name) {
1527  w = CG_DrawStrlen(name) * BIGCHAR_WIDTH;
1528  x = (SCREEN_WIDTH - w) / 2;
1529  CG_DrawBigStringColor(x, y - 22, name, color);
1530  }
1531  }
1532 
1533  trap_R_SetColor(NULL);
1534 }

529 {
530  entityState_t* es;
531  int event;
532  vec3_t dir;
533  const char* s;
534  int clientNum;
535  clientInfo_t* ci;
536 
537  es = &cent->currentState;
538  event = es->event & ~EV_EVENT_BITS;
539 
540  if (cg_debugEvents.integer) {
541  CG_Printf("ent:%3i event:%3i ", es->number, event);
542  }
543 
544  if (!event) {
545  DEBUGNAME("ZEROEVENT");
546  return;
547  }
548 
549  clientNum = es->clientNum;
550  if (clientNum < 0 || clientNum >= MAX_CLIENTS) {
551  clientNum = 0;
552  }
553  ci = &cgs.clientinfo[clientNum];
554 
555  switch (event) {
556  //
557  // movement generated events
558  //
559  case EV_FOOTSTEP:
560  DEBUGNAME("EV_FOOTSTEP");
561  if (cg_footsteps.integer) {
562  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_BODY,
563  cgs.media.footsteps[ci->footsteps][rand() & 3]);
564  }
565  break;
566  case EV_FOOTSTEP_METAL:
567  DEBUGNAME("EV_FOOTSTEP_METAL");

569  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_BODY,
570  cgs.media.footsteps[FOOTSTEP_METAL][rand() & 3]);
571  }
572  break;
573  case EV_FOOTSPLASH:
574  DEBUGNAME("EV_FOOTSPLASH");
575  if (cg_footsteps.integer) {

577  cgs.media.footsteps[FOOTSTEP_SPLASH][rand() & 3]);
578  }
579  break;
580  case EV_FOOTWADE:
581  DEBUGNAME("EV_FOOTWADE");
582  if (cg_footsteps.integer) {
583  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_BODY,
584  cgs.media.footsteps[FOOTSTEP_SPLASH][rand() & 3]);
585  }
586  break;

588  DEBUGNAME("EV_SWIM");
589  if (cg_footsteps.integer) {
590  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_BODY,
591  cgs.media.footsteps[FOOTSTEP_SPLASH][rand() & 3]);
592  }
593  break;
594 
595 
596  case EV_FALL_SHORT:
597  DEBUGNAME("EV_FALL_SHORT");
598  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_AUTO, cgs.media.landSound);
599  if (clientNum == cg.predictedPlayerState.clientNum) {
600  // smooth landing z changes
601  cg.landChange = -8;
602  cg.landTime = cg.time;
603  }
604  break;
605  case EV_FALL_MEDIUM:
606  DEBUGNAME("EV_FALL_MEDIUM");
607  // use normal pain sound
608  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_VOICE, CG_CustomSound(es->number, "*pain100_1.wav"));
609  if (clientNum == cg.predictedPlayerState.clientNum) {
610  // smooth landing z changes
611  cg.landChange = -16;
612  cg.landTime = cg.time;
613  }
614  break;
615  case EV_FALL_FAR:
616  DEBUGNAME("EV_FALL_FAR");
617  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_AUTO, CG_CustomSound(es->number, "*fall1.wav"));
618  cent->pe.painTime = cg.time; // don't play a pain sound right after this
619  if (clientNum == cg.predictedPlayerState.clientNum) {
620  // smooth landing z changes
621  cg.landChange = -24;
622  cg.landTime = cg.time;
623  }
624  break;
625 
626  case EV_STEP_4:
627  case EV_STEP_8:
628  case EV_STEP_12:
629  case EV_STEP_16: // smooth out step up transitions
630  DEBUGNAME("EV_STEP");
631  {
632  float oldStep;
633  int delta;
634  int step;
635 
636  if (clientNum != cg.predictedPlayerState.clientNum) {
637  break;
638  }
639  // if we are interpolating, we don't need to smooth steps
640  if (cg.demoPlayback || (cg.snap->ps.pm_flags & PMF_FOLLOW) ||
641  cg_nopredict.integer || cg_synchronousClients.integer) {
642  break;
643  }
644  // check for stepping up before a previous step is completed
645  delta = cg.time - cg.stepTime;
646  if (delta < STEP_TIME) {
647  oldStep = cg.stepChange * (STEP_TIME - delta) / STEP_TIME;
648  } else {
649  oldStep = 0;
650  }
651 
652  // add this amount
653  step = 4 * (event - EV_STEP_4 + 1);
654  cg.stepChange = oldStep + step;
655  if (cg.stepChange > MAX_STEP_CHANGE) {
656  cg.stepChange = MAX_STEP_CHANGE;
657  }
658  cg.stepTime = cg.time;
659  break;
660  }
661 
662  case EV_JUMP_PAD:
663  DEBUGNAME("EV_JUMP_PAD");
664  // CG_Printf( "EV_JUMP_PAD w/effect #%i\n", es->eventParm );
665  {
666  vec3_t up = { 0, 0, 1 };
667 
668 
669  CG_SmokePuff(cent->lerpOrigin, up,
670  32,
671  1, 1, 1, 0.33f,
672  1000,
673  cg.time, 0,
674  LEF_PUFF_DONT_SCALE,
675  cgs.media.smokePuffShader);

1036  case EV_GLOBAL_SOUND: // play from the player's head so it never diminishes
1037  DEBUGNAME("EV_GLOBAL_SOUND");
1038  if (cgs.gameSounds[es->eventParm]) {
1039  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, cg.snap->ps.clientNum, CHAN_AUTO, cgs.gameSounds[es->eventParm]);
1040  } else {
1041  s = CG_ConfigString(CS_SOUNDS + es->eventParm);
1042  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, cg.snap->ps.clientNum, CHAN_AUTO, CG_CustomSound(es->number, s));
1043  }
1044  break;
1045 
1046  case EV_GLOBAL_TEAM_SOUND: // play from the player's head so it never diminishes
1047  {
1048  DEBUGNAME("EV_GLOBAL_TEAM_SOUND");
1049  switch (es->eventParm) {
1050  case GTS_RED_CAPTURE: // CTF: red team captured the blue flag, 1FCTF: red team captured the neutral flag
1051  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_RED)
1052  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.captureYourTeamSound);
1053  else
1054  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.captureOpponentSound);
1055  break;
1056  case GTS_BLUE_CAPTURE: // CTF: blue team captured the red flag, 1FCTF: blue team captured the neutral flag
1057  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_BLUE)
1058  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.captureYourTeamSound);
1059  else
1060  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.captureOpponentSound);
1061  break;
1062  case GTS_RED_RETURN: // CTF: blue flag returned, 1FCTF: never used
1063  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_RED)
1064  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.returnYourTeamSound);
1065  else
1066  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.returnOpponentSound);
1067  //
1068  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.blueFlagReturnedSound);
1069  break;
1070  case GTS_BLUE_RETURN: // CTF red flag returned, 1FCTF: neutral flag returned
1071  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_BLUE)
1072  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.returnYourTeamSound);
1073  else
1074  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.returnOpponentSound);
1075  //
1076  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.redFlagReturnedSound);
1077  break;
1078 
1079  case GTS_RED_TAKEN: // CTF: red team took blue flag, 1FCTF: blue team took the neutral flag
1080  // if this player picked up the flag then a sound is played in CG_CheckLocalSounds
1081  if (cg.snap->ps.powerups[PW_BLUEFLAG] || cg.snap->ps.powerups[PW_NEUTRALFLAG]) {
1082  } else {
1083  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_BLUE) {
1084 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1085  if (cgs.gametype == GT_1FCTF)
1086  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.yourTeamTookTheFlagSound);
1087  else
1088 #endif
1089  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.enemyTookYourFlagSound);
1090  } else if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_RED) {
1091 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1092  if (cgs.gametype == GT_1FCTF)
1093  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.enemyTookTheFlagSound);
1094  else
1095 #endif
1096  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.yourTeamTookEnemyFlagSound);
1097  }
1098  }
1099  break;
1100  case GTS_BLUE_TAKEN: // CTF: blue team took the red flag, 1FCTF red team took the neutral flag
1101  // if this player picked up the flag then a sound is played in CG_CheckLocalSounds
1102  if (cg.snap->ps.powerups[PW_REDFLAG] || cg.snap->ps.powerups[PW_NEUTRALFLAG]) {
1103  } else {
1104  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_RED) {
1105 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1106  if (cgs.gametype == GT_1FCTF)
1107  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.yourTeamTookTheFlagSound);
1108  else
1109 #endif
1110  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.enemyTookYourFlagSound);
1111  } else if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_BLUE) {
1112 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1113  if (cgs.gametype == GT_1FCTF)
1114  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.enemyTookTheFlagSound);
1115  else
1116 #endif
1117  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.yourTeamTookEnemyFlagSound);
1118  }
1119  }
1120  break;
1121 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1122  case GTS_REDOBELISK_ATTACKED: // Overload: red obelisk is being attacked
1123  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_RED) {
1124  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.yourBaseIsUnderAttackSound);
1125  }
1126  break;
1127  case GTS_BLUEOBELISK_ATTACKED: // Overload: blue obelisk is being attacked
1128  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_BLUE) {
1129  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.yourBaseIsUnderAttackSound);
1130  }
1131  break;
1132 #endif
1133 
1134  case GTS_REDTEAM_SCORED:
1135  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.redScoredSound);
1136  break;
1137  case GTS_BLUETEAM_SCORED:
1138  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.blueScoredSound);
1139  break;
1140  case GTS_REDTEAM_TOOK_LEAD:
1141  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.redLeadsSound);
1142  break;
1143  case GTS_BLUETEAM_TOOK_LEAD:
1144  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.blueLeadsSound);
1145  break;
1146  case GTS_TEAMS_ARE_TIED:
1147  CG_AddBufferedSound(cgs.media.teamsTiedSound);
1148  break;
1149 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1150  case GTS_KAMIKAZE:
1151  trap_S_StartLocalSound(cgs.media.kamikazeFarSound, CHAN_ANNOUNCER);
1152  break;
1153 #endif
1154  default:
1155  break;
1156  }
1157  break;
1158  }
1159 
1160  case EV_PAIN:
1161  // local player sounds are triggered in CG_CheckLocalSounds,
1162  // so ignore events on the player
1163  DEBUGNAME("EV_PAIN");
1164  if (cent->currentState.number != cg.snap->ps.clientNum) {
1165  CG_PainEvent(cent, es->eventParm);
1166  }
1167  break;
1168 
1169  case EV_DEATH1:
1170  case EV_DEATH2:
1171  case EV_DEATH3:
1172  DEBUGNAME("EV_DEATHx");
1173 
1174  if (CG_WaterLevel(cent) == 3) {
1175  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_VOICE, CG_CustomSound(es->number, "*drown.wav"));
1176  } else {
1177  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_VOICE, CG_CustomSound(es->number, va("*death%i.wav", event - EV_DEATH1 + 1)));
1178  }
1179 
1180  break;
1181 
1182 
1183  case EV_OBITUARY:
1184  DEBUGNAME("EV_OBITUARY");
1185  CG_Obituary(es);
1186  break;
1187 
1188  //
1189  // powerup events
1190  //
1191  case EV_POWERUP_QUAD:
1192  DEBUGNAME("EV_POWERUP_QUAD");
1193  if (es->number == cg.snap->ps.clientNum) {
1194  cg.powerupActive = PW_QUAD;
1195  cg.powerupTime = cg.time;
1196  }
1197  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_ITEM, cgs.media.quadSound);
1198  break;
1199  case EV_POWERUP_BATTLESUIT:
1200  DEBUGNAME("EV_POWERUP_BATTLESUIT");
1201  if (es->number == cg.snap->ps.clientNum) {
1202  cg.powerupActive = PW_BATTLESUIT;
1203  cg.powerupTime = cg.time;
1204  }
1205  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_ITEM, cgs.media.protectSound);
1206  break;
1207  case EV_POWERUP_REGEN:
1208  DEBUGNAME("EV_POWERUP_REGEN");
1209  if (es->number == cg.snap->ps.clientNum) {
1210  cg.powerupActive = PW_REGEN;
1211  cg.powerupTime = cg.time;
1212  }
1213  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_ITEM, cgs.media.regenSound);
1214  break;
1215 
1216  case EV_GIB_PLAYER:
1217  DEBUGNAME("EV_GIB_PLAYER");
1218  // don't play gib sound when using the kamikaze because it interferes
1219  // with the kamikaze sound, downside is that the gib sound will also
1220  // not be played when someone is gibbed while just carrying the kamikaze
1221  if (!(es->eFlags & EF_KAMIKAZE)) {
1222  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, es->number, CHAN_BODY, cgs.media.gibSound);
1223  }
1224  CG_GibPlayer(cent->lerpOrigin);
1225  break;
1226 
1227  case EV_STOPLOOPINGSOUND:
1228  DEBUGNAME("EV_STOPLOOPINGSOUND");
1229  trap_S_StopLoopingSound(es->number);
1230  es->loopSound = 0;
1231  break;
1232 
1233  case EV_DEBUG_LINE:
1234  DEBUGNAME("EV_DEBUG_LINE");
1235  CG_Beam(cent);
1236  break;
1237 
1238  default:
1239  DEBUGNAME("UNKNOWN");
1240  CG_Error("Unknown event: %i", event);
1241  break;
1242  }
1243 
1244 }

◆ CG_FadeColor()

float* CG_FadeColor ( int  startMsec,
int  totalMsec 
)

Definition at line 343 of file cg_drawtools.c.

344 {
345  static vec4_t color;
346  int t;
347 
348  if (startMsec == 0) {
349  return NULL;
350  }
351 
352  t = cg.time - startMsec;
353 
354  if (t >= totalMsec) {
355  return NULL;
356  }
357 
358  // fade out
359  if (totalMsec - t < FADE_TIME) {
360  color[3] = (totalMsec - t) * 1.0 / FADE_TIME;
361  } else {
362  color[3] = 1.0;
363  }
364  color[0] = color[1] = color[2] = 1;
365 
366  return color;
367 }

◆ CG_FireWeapon()

1702

1704  if (ent->weapon == WP_NONE) {
1705  return;
1706  }
1707  if (ent->weapon >= WP_NUM_WEAPONS) {
1708  CG_Error("CG_FireWeapon: ent->weapon >= WP_NUM_WEAPONS");
1709  return;
1710  }

1712

1714  // append the flash to the weapon model
1715  cent->muzzleFlashTime = cg.time;
1716

1718  if (ent->weapon == WP_LIGHTNING) {
1719  if (cent->pe.lightningFiring) {
1720  return;
1721  }
1722  }
1723 
1724  if (ent->weapon == WP_RAILGUN) {
1725  cent->pe.railFireTime = cg.time;
1726  }
1727

1729  if (cent->currentState.powerups & (1 << PW_QUAD)) {
1730  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, cent->currentState.number, CHAN_ITEM, cgs.media.quadSound);
1731  }
1732

1734  for (c = 0; c < 4; c++) {
1735  if (!weap->flashSound[c]) {
1736  break;
1737  }
1738  }
1739  if (c > 0) {
1740  c = rand() % c;
1741  if (weap->flashSound[c]) {
1742  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, ent->number, CHAN_WEAPON, weap->flashSound[c]);
1743  }
1744  }
1745 
1746  // do brass ejection

1748  weap->ejectBrassFunc(cent);
1749  }
1750 }

◆ CG_GetColorForHealth()

void CG_GetColorForHealth ( int  health,
int  armor,
vec4_t  hcolor 
)

Definition at line 401 of file cg_drawtools.c.

402 {
403  int count;
404  int max;
405 
406  // calculate the total points of damage that can
407  // be sustained at the current health / armor level
408  if (health <= 0) {
409  VectorClear(hcolor); // black
410  hcolor[3] = 1;
411  return;
412  }
413  count = armor;
414  max = health * ARMOR_PROTECTION / (1.0 - ARMOR_PROTECTION);
415  if (max < count) {
416  count = max;
417  }
418  health += count;
419 
420  // set the color based on health
421  hcolor[0] = 1.0;
422  hcolor[3] = 1.0;
423  if (health >= 100) {
424  hcolor[2] = 1.0;
425  } else if (health < 66) {
426  hcolor[2] = 0;
427  } else {
428  hcolor[2] = (health - 66) / 33.0;
429  }
430 
431  if (health > 60) {
432  hcolor[1] = 1.0;
433  } else if (health < 30) {
434  hcolor[1] = 0;
435  } else {
436  hcolor[1] = (health - 30) / 30.0;
437  }
438 }

650  velocity[2] = GIB_JUMP + crandom() * GIB_VELOCITY;
651  CG_LaunchGib(origin, velocity, cgs.media.gibLeg);
652 }

◆ CG_ImpactMark()

void CG_ImpactMark ( qhandle_t  markShader,
const vec3_t  origin,
const vec3_t  dir,
float  orientation,
float  r,
float  g,
float  b,
float  a,
qboolean  alphaFade,
float  radius,
qboolean  temporary 
)

Definition at line 133 of file cg_marks.c.

136 {
137  vec3_t axis[3];
138  float texCoordScale;
139  vec3_t originalPoints[4];
140  byte colors[4];
141  int i, j;
142  int numFragments;
143  markFragment_t markFragments[MAX_MARK_FRAGMENTS], * mf;
144  vec3_t markPoints[MAX_MARK_POINTS];
145  vec3_t projection;
146 
147  if (!cg_addMarks.integer) {
148  return;
149  }
150 
151  if (radius <= 0) {
152  CG_Error("CG_ImpactMark called with <= 0 radius");
153  }
154 
155  //if ( markTotal >= MAX_MARK_POLYS ) {
156  // return;
157  //}
158 
159  // create the texture axis
160  VectorNormalize2(dir, axis[0]);
161  PerpendicularVector(axis[1], axis[0]);
162  RotatePointAroundVector(axis[2], axis[0], axis[1], orientation);
163  CrossProduct(axis[0], axis[2], axis[1]);
164 
165  texCoordScale = 0.5 * 1.0 / radius;
166 
167  // create the full polygon
168  for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
169  originalPoints[0][i] = origin[i] - radius * axis[1][i] - radius * axis[2][i];
170  originalPoints[1][i] = origin[i] + radius * axis[1][i] - radius * axis[2][i];
171  originalPoints[2][i] = origin[i] + radius * axis[1][i] + radius * axis[2][i];
172  originalPoints[3][i] = origin[i] - radius * axis[1][i] + radius * axis[2][i];
173  }
174 
175  // get the fragments
176  VectorScale(dir, -20, projection);
177  numFragments = trap_CM_MarkFragments(4, (void*)originalPoints,
178  projection, MAX_MARK_POINTS, markPoints[0],
179  MAX_MARK_FRAGMENTS, markFragments);
180 
181  colors[0] = red * 255;
182  colors[1] = green * 255;
183  colors[2] = blue * 255;
184  colors[3] = alpha * 255;
185 
186  for (i = 0, mf = markFragments; i < numFragments; i++, mf++) {
187  polyVert_t* v;
188  polyVert_t verts[MAX_VERTS_ON_POLY];
189  markPoly_t* mark;
190 
191  // we have an upper limit on the complexity of polygons
192  // that we store persistantly
193  if (mf->numPoints > MAX_VERTS_ON_POLY) {
194  mf->numPoints = MAX_VERTS_ON_POLY;
195  }
196  for (j = 0, v = verts; j < mf->numPoints; j++, v++) {
197  vec3_t delta;
198 
199  VectorCopy(markPoints[mf->firstPoint + j], v->xyz);
200 
201  VectorSubtract(v->xyz, origin, delta);
202  v->st[0] = 0.5 + DotProduct(delta, axis[1]) * texCoordScale;
203  v->st[1] = 0.5 + DotProduct(delta, axis[2]) * texCoordScale;
204  *(int*)v->modulate = *(int*)colors;
205  }
206 
207  // if it is a temporary (shadow) mark, add it immediately and forget about it
208  if (temporary) {
209  trap_R_AddPolyToScene(markShader, mf->numPoints, verts);
210  continue;
211  }
212 
213  // otherwise save it persistantly
214  mark = CG_AllocMark();
215  mark->time = cg.time;
216  mark->alphaFade = alphaFade;
217  mark->markShader = markShader;
218  mark->poly.numVerts = mf->numPoints;
219  mark->color[0] = red;
220  mark->color[1] = green;
221  mark->color[2] = blue;
222  mark->color[3] = alpha;
223  memcpy(mark->verts, verts, mf->numPoints * sizeof(verts[0]));
224  markTotal++;
225  }
226 }

Referenced by CG_FragmentBounceMark(), CG_MissileHitWall(), and CG_PlayerShadow().

localEntity_t* CG_MakeExplosion ( vec3_t  origin,

Definition at line 442 of file cg_effects.c.

445 {
446  float ang;
447  localEntity_t* ex;
448  int offset;
449  vec3_t tmpVec, newOrigin;
450 
451  if (msec <= 0) {
452  CG_Error("CG_MakeExplosion: msec = %i", msec);
453  }
454 
455  // skew the time a bit so they aren't all in sync
456  offset = rand() & 63;
457 
458  ex = CG_AllocLocalEntity();
459  if (isSprite) {
460  ex->leType = LE_SPRITE_EXPLOSION;
461 
462  // randomly rotate sprite orientation
463  ex->refEntity.rotation = rand() % 360;
464  VectorScale(dir, 16, tmpVec);
465  VectorAdd(tmpVec, origin, newOrigin);
466  } else {
467  ex->leType = LE_EXPLOSION;
468  VectorCopy(origin, newOrigin);
469 
470  // set axis with random rotate
471  if (!dir) {
472  AxisClear(ex->refEntity.axis);
473  } else {
474  ang = rand() % 360;
475  VectorCopy(dir, ex->refEntity.axis[0]);
476  RotateAroundDirection(ex->refEntity.axis, ang);
477  }
478  }
479 
480  ex->startTime = cg.time - offset;
481  ex->endTime = ex->startTime + msec;
482 
483  // bias the time so all shader effects start correctly
484  ex->refEntity.shaderTime = ex->startTime / 1000.0f;
485 
486  ex->refEntity.hModel = hModel;
487  ex->refEntity.customShader = shader;
488 
489  // set origin
490  VectorCopy(newOrigin, ex->refEntity.origin);
491  VectorCopy(newOrigin, ex->refEntity.oldorigin);
492 
493  ex->color[0] = ex->color[1] = ex->color[2] = 1.0;
494 
495  return ex;
496 }

1882  mark = cgs.media.bulletMarkShader;
1883  sfx = 0;
1884  radius = 4;
1885  break;

1889  mod = cgs.media.bulletFlashModel;

1891  sfx = cgs.media.sfx_chghitflesh;
1892  } else if (soundType == IMPACTSOUND_METAL) {
1893  sfx = cgs.media.sfx_chghitmetal;
1894  } else {
1895  sfx = cgs.media.sfx_chghit;
1896  }
1897  mark = cgs.media.bulletMarkShader;
1898 
1899  radius = 8;
1900  break;
1901 #endif
1902 
1903  case WP_MACHINEGUN:

1905  shader = cgs.media.bulletExplosionShader;
1906  mark = cgs.media.bulletMarkShader;
1907 
1908  r = rand() & 3;
1909  if (r == 0) {
1910  sfx = cgs.media.sfx_ric1;
1911  } else if (r == 1) {
1912  sfx = cgs.media.sfx_ric2;
1913  } else {

1915  }

1917  radius = 8;

1946  //

1953  CG_ImpactMark(mark, origin, dir, random() * 360, color[0], color[1], color[2], 1, alphaFade, radius, qfalse);

1956  }
1957 }

891  }

954  if (cg_forceModel.integer) {
955  // forcemodel makes everyone use a single model
956  // to prevent load hitches
957  char modelStr[MAX_QPATH];
958  char* skin;
959 
960  if (cgs.gametype >= GT_TEAM) {
961  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.modelName, DEFAULT_TEAM_MODEL, sizeof(newInfo.modelName));
962  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.skinName, "default", sizeof(newInfo.skinName));
963  } else {
964  trap_Cvar_VariableStringBuffer("model", modelStr, sizeof(modelStr));
965  if ((skin = strchr(modelStr, '/')) == NULL) {
966  skin = "default";
967  } else {
968  *skin++ = 0;
969  }
970

973  }
974

976  // keep skin name
977  slash = strchr(v, '/');
978  if (slash) {
979  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.skinName, slash + 1, sizeof(newInfo.skinName));
980  }
981  }
982  } else {
983  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.modelName, v, sizeof(newInfo.modelName));
984 
985  slash = strchr(newInfo.modelName, '/');
986  if (!slash) {
987  // modelName didn not include a skin name
988  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.skinName, "default", sizeof(newInfo.skinName));
989  } else {
990  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.skinName, slash + 1, sizeof(newInfo.skinName));
991  // truncate modelName
992  *slash = 0;
993  }
994  }
995 
996  // head model
997  v = Info_ValueForKey(configstring, "hmodel");
998  if (cg_forceModel.integer) {
999  // forcemodel makes everyone use a single model
1000  // to prevent load hitches
1001  char modelStr[MAX_QPATH];
1002  char* skin;
1003 
1004  if (cgs.gametype >= GT_TEAM) {
1005  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.headModelName, DEFAULT_TEAM_HEAD, sizeof(newInfo.headModelName));

1007  } else {
1008  trap_Cvar_VariableStringBuffer("headmodel", modelStr, sizeof(modelStr));
1009  if ((skin = strchr(modelStr, '/')) == NULL) {
1010  skin = "default";
1011  } else {
1012  *skin++ = 0;
1013  }
1014

1017  }
1018

1020  // keep skin name
1021  slash = strchr(v, '/');
1022  if (slash) {
1023  Q_strncpyz(newInfo.headSkinName, slash + 1, sizeof(newInfo.headSkinName));

1041  // so we can avoid loading checks if possible
1042  if (!CG_ScanForExistingClientInfo(&newInfo)) {
1043  qboolean forceDefer;
1044 
1045  forceDefer = trap_MemoryRemaining() < 4000000;
1046 
1047  // if we are defering loads, just have it pick the first valid
1048  if (forceDefer || (cg_deferPlayers.integer && !cg_buildScript.integer && !cg.loading)) {
1049  // keep whatever they had if it won't violate team skins
1050  CG_SetDeferredClientInfo(clientNum, &newInfo);
1051  // if we are low on memory, leave them with this model
1052  if (forceDefer) {
1053  CG_Printf("Memory is low. Using deferred model.\n");
1054  newInfo.deferred = qfalse;
1055  }
1056  } else {
1057  CG_LoadClientInfo(clientNum, &newInfo);
1058  }
1059  }

1062  newInfo.infoValid = qtrue;

1266  if (!str[0])
1267  return (0);
1268 
1269  // returns type 128 64 or 32
1270  token = COM_Parse(&str);
1271  type = atoi(token);
1272 
1273  if (type == 1)
1274  range = 128;
1275  else if (type == 2)
1276  range = 64;
1277  else if (type == 3)
1278  range = 32;
1279  else if (type == 0)
1280  range = 256;
1281  else if (type == 4)
1282  range = 8;
1283  else if (type == 5)
1284  range = 16;
1285  else if (type == 6)
1286  range = 32;
1287  else if (type == 7)
1288  range = 64;
1289 
1290 
1291  for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
1292  token = COM_Parse(&str);
1293  origin[i] = atof(token);
1294  }
1295 
1296  for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
1297  token = COM_Parse(&str);
1298  origin2[i] = atof(token);
1299  }
1300 
1301  token = COM_Parse(&str);
1302  numparticles = atoi(token);
1303 
1304  token = COM_Parse(&str);
1305  turb = atoi(token);
1306 
1307  token = COM_Parse(&str);
1308  snum = atoi(token);
1309 
1310  for (i = 0; i < numparticles; i++) {
1311  if (type >= 4)
1312  CG_ParticleBubble(cgs.media.waterBubbleShader, origin, origin2, turb, range, snum);
1313  else
1314  CG_ParticleSnow(cgs.media.waterBubbleShader, origin, origin2, turb, range, snum);
1315  }
1316 
1317  return (1);
1318 }

1583  break;
1584  }
1585  }

485 {
486  char* snd;
487 
488  // don't do more than two pain sounds a second
489  if (cg.time - cent->pe.painTime < 500) {
490  return;
491  }
492 
493  if (health < 25) {
494  snd = "*pain25_1.wav";
495  } else if (health < 50) {
496  snd = "*pain50_1.wav";
497  } else if (health < 75) {
498  snd = "*pain75_1.wav";
499  } else {
500  snd = "*pain100_1.wav";
501  }
502  // play a gurp sound instead of a normal pain sound
503  if (CG_WaterLevel(cent) == 3) {
504  if (rand() & 1) {
505  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, cent->currentState.number, CHAN_VOICE, CG_CustomSound(cent->currentState.number, "sound/player/gurp1.wav"));
506  } else {
507  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, cent->currentState.number, CHAN_VOICE, CG_CustomSound(cent->currentState.number, "sound/player/gurp2.wav"));
508  }
509  } else {
510  trap_S_StartSound(NULL, cent->currentState.number, CHAN_VOICE, CG_CustomSound(cent->currentState.number, snd));
511  }
512  // save pain time for programitic twitch animation
513  cent->pe.painTime = cg.time;
514  cent->pe.painDirection ^= 1;
515 }

Referenced by CG_CheckLocalSounds(), and CG_EntityEvent().

1835  dist = length / crittersize;
1836

1838  dist = 1;

1863  else

1865

1877  p->height *= 0.2f;
1878

1880  p->endwidth = NORMALSIZE;
1881  }

2269  // from the entity number, because a single client may have
2270  // multiple corpses on the level using the same clientinfo

2272  if (clientNum < 0 || clientNum >= MAX_CLIENTS) {

2274  }

◆ CG_PredictPlayerState()

void CG_PredictPlayerState ( void  )

Definition at line 419 of file cg_predict.c.

420 {
421  int cmdNum, current;
422  playerState_t oldPlayerState;
423  qboolean moved;
424  usercmd_t oldestCmd;
425  usercmd_t latestCmd;
426 
427  cg.hyperspace = qfalse; // will be set if touching a trigger_teleport
428 
429  // if this is the first frame we must guarantee
430  // predictedPlayerState is valid even if there is some
431  // other error condition
432  if (!cg.validPPS) {
433  cg.validPPS = qtrue;
434  cg.predictedPlayerState = cg.snap->ps;
435  }
436 
437 
438  // demo playback just copies the moves
439  if (cg.demoPlayback || (cg.snap->ps.pm_flags & PMF_FOLLOW)) {
440  CG_InterpolatePlayerState(qfalse);
441  return;
442  }
443 
444  // non-predicting local movement will grab the latest angles
445  if (cg_nopredict.integer || cg_synchronousClients.integer) {
446  CG_InterpolatePlayerState(qtrue);
447  return;
448  }
449 
450  // prepare for pmove
451  cg_pmove.ps = &cg.predictedPlayerState;
452  cg_pmove.trace = CG_Trace;
453  cg_pmove.pointcontents = CG_PointContents;
454  if (cg_pmove.ps->pm_type == PM_DEAD) {
455  cg_pmove.tracemask = MASK_PLAYERSOLID & ~CONTENTS_BODY;
456  } else {
457  cg_pmove.tracemask = MASK_PLAYERSOLID;
458  }
459  if (cg.snap->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] == TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
460  cg_pmove.tracemask &= ~CONTENTS_BODY; // spectators can fly through bodies
461  }
462  cg_pmove.noFootsteps = (cgs.dmflags & DF_NO_FOOTSTEPS) > 0;
463 
464  // save the state before the pmove so we can detect transitions
465  oldPlayerState = cg.predictedPlayerState;
466 
467  current = trap_GetCurrentCmdNumber();
468 
469  // if we don't have the commands right after the snapshot, we
470  // can't accurately predict a current position, so just freeze at
471  // the last good position we had
472  cmdNum = current - CMD_BACKUP + 1;
473  trap_GetUserCmd(cmdNum, &oldestCmd);
474  if (oldestCmd.serverTime > cg.snap->ps.commandTime
475  && oldestCmd.serverTime < cg.time) { // special check for map_restart
476  if (cg_showmiss.integer) {
477  CG_Printf("exceeded PACKET_BACKUP on commands\n");
478  }
479  return;
480  }
481 
482  // get the latest command so we can know which commands are from previous map_restarts
483  trap_GetUserCmd(current, &latestCmd);
484 
485  // get the most recent information we have, even if
486  // the server time is beyond our current cg.time,
487  // because predicted player positions are going to
488  // be ahead of everything else anyway
489  if (cg.nextSnap && !cg.nextFrameTeleport && !cg.thisFrameTeleport) {
490  cg.predictedPlayerState = cg.nextSnap->ps;
491  cg.physicsTime = cg.nextSnap->serverTime;
492  } else {
493  cg.predictedPlayerState = cg.snap->ps;
494  cg.physicsTime = cg.snap->serverTime;
495  }
496 
497  if (pmove_msec.integer < 8) {
498  trap_Cvar_Set("pmove_msec", "8");
499  trap_Cvar_Update(&pmove_msec);
500  } else if (pmove_msec.integer > 33) {
501  trap_Cvar_Set("pmove_msec", "33");
502  trap_Cvar_Update(&pmove_msec);
503  }
504 
505  cg_pmove.pmove_fixed = pmove_fixed.integer;// | cg_pmove_fixed.integer;
506  cg_pmove.pmove_msec = pmove_msec.integer;
507 
508  // run cmds
509  moved = qfalse;
510  for (cmdNum = current - CMD_BACKUP + 1; cmdNum <= current; cmdNum++) {
511  // get the command
512  trap_GetUserCmd(cmdNum, &cg_pmove.cmd);
513 
514  if (cg_pmove.pmove_fixed) {
515  PM_UpdateViewAngles(cg_pmove.ps, &cg_pmove.cmd);
516  }
517 
518  // don't do anything if the time is before the snapshot player time
519  if (cg_pmove.cmd.serverTime <= cg.predictedPlayerState.commandTime) {
520  continue;
521  }
522 
523  // don't do anything if the command was from a previous map_restart
524  if (cg_pmove.cmd.serverTime > latestCmd.serverTime) {
525  continue;
526  }
527 
528  // check for a prediction error from last frame
529  // on a lan, this will often be the exact value
530  // from the snapshot, but on a wan we will have
531  // to predict several commands to get to the point
532  // we want to compare
533  if (cg.predictedPlayerState.commandTime == oldPlayerState.commandTime) {
534  vec3_t delta;
535  float len;
536 
537  if (cg.thisFrameTeleport) {
538  // a teleport will not cause an error decay
539  VectorClear(cg.predictedError);
540  if (cg_showmiss.integer) {
541  CG_Printf("PredictionTeleport\n");
542  }
543  cg.thisFrameTeleport = qfalse;
544  } else {
545  vec3_t adjusted, new_angles;
546  CG_AdjustPositionForMover(cg.predictedPlayerState.origin,
547  cg.predictedPlayerState.groundEntityNum, cg.physicsTime, cg.oldTime, adjusted, cg.predictedPlayerState.viewangles, new_angles);
548 
549  if (cg_showmiss.integer) {
550  if (!VectorCompare(oldPlayerState.origin, adjusted)) {
551  CG_Printf("prediction error\n");
552  }
553  }
554  VectorSubtract(oldPlayerState.origin, adjusted, delta);
555  len = VectorLength(delta);
556  if (len > 0.1) {
557  if (cg_showmiss.integer) {
558  CG_Printf("Prediction miss: %f\n", len);
559  }
560  if (cg_errorDecay.integer) {
561  int t;
562  float f;
563 
564  t = cg.time - cg.predictedErrorTime;
565  f = (cg_errorDecay.value - t) / cg_errorDecay.value;
566  if (f < 0) {
567  f = 0;
568  }
569  if (f > 0 && cg_showmiss.integer) {
570  CG_Printf("Double prediction decay: %f\n", f);
571  }
572  VectorScale(cg.predictedError, f, cg.predictedError);
573  } else {
574  VectorClear(cg.predictedError);
575  }
576  VectorAdd(delta, cg.predictedError, cg.predictedError);
577  cg.predictedErrorTime = cg.oldTime;
578  }
579  }
580  }
581 
582  // don't predict gauntlet firing, which is only supposed to happen
583  // when it actually inflicts damage
584  cg_pmove.gauntletHit = qfalse;
585 
586  if (cg_pmove.pmove_fixed) {
587  cg_pmove.cmd.serverTime = ((cg_pmove.cmd.serverTime + pmove_msec.integer - 1) / pmove_msec.integer) * pmove_msec.integer;
588  }
589 
590  Pmove(&cg_pmove);
591 
592  moved = qtrue;
593 
594  // add push trigger movement effects
595  CG_TouchTriggerPrediction();
596 
597  // check for predictable events that changed from previous predictions
598  //CG_CheckChangedPredictableEvents(&cg.predictedPlayerState);
599  }
600 
601  if (cg_showmiss.integer > 1) {
602  CG_Printf("[%i : %i] ", cg_pmove.cmd.serverTime, cg.time);
603  }
604 
605  if (!moved) {
606  if (cg_showmiss.integer) {
607  CG_Printf("not moved\n");
608  }
609  return;
610  }
611 
612  // adjust for the movement of the groundentity
613  CG_AdjustPositionForMover(cg.predictedPlayerState.origin,
614  cg.predictedPlayerState.groundEntityNum,
615  cg.physicsTime, cg.time, cg.predictedPlayerState.origin, cg.predictedPlayerState.viewangles, cg.predictedPlayerState.viewangles);
616 
617  if (cg_showmiss.integer) {
618  if (cg.predictedPlayerState.eventSequence > oldPlayerState.eventSequence + MAX_PS_EVENTS) {
619  CG_Printf("WARNING: dropped event\n");
620  }
621  }
622 
623  // fire events and other transition triggered things
624  CG_TransitionPlayerState(&cg.predictedPlayerState, &oldPlayerState);
625 
626  if (cg_showmiss.integer) {
627  if (cg.eventSequence > cg.predictedPlayerState.eventSequence) {
628  CG_Printf("WARNING: double event\n");
629  cg.eventSequence = cg.predictedPlayerState.eventSequence;
630  }
631  }
632 }

◆ CG_PrevWeapon_f()

void CG_PrevWeapon_f ( void  )

1599  int original;
1600 
1601  if (!cg.snap) {
1602  return;
1603  }
1604  if (cg.snap->ps.pm_flags & PMF_FOLLOW) {
1605  return;

1612  cg.weaponSelect--;
1613  if (cg.weaponSelect == -1) {
1614  cg.weaponSelect = MAX_WEAPONS - 1;
1615  }

1620  break;
1621  }
1622  }

1624  cg.weaponSelect = original;
1625  }
1626 }

◆ CG_Printf()

void QDECL CG_Printf ( const char *  msg,

◆ CG_ProcessSnapshots()

void CG_ProcessSnapshots ( void  )

Definition at line 323 of file cg_snapshot.c.

324 {
325  snapshot_t* snap;
326  int n;
327 
328  // see what the latest snapshot the client system has is
329  trap_GetCurrentSnapshotNumber(&n, &cg.latestSnapshotTime);
330  if (n != cg.latestSnapshotNum) {
331  if (n < cg.latestSnapshotNum) {
332  // this should never happen
333  CG_Error("CG_ProcessSnapshots: n < cg.latestSnapshotNum");
334  }
335  cg.latestSnapshotNum = n;
336  }
337 
338  // If we have yet to receive a snapshot, check for it.
339  // Once we have gotten the first snapshot, cg.snap will
340  // always have valid data for the rest of the game
341  while (!cg.snap) {
342  snap = CG_ReadNextSnapshot();
343  if (!snap) {
344  // we can't continue until we get a snapshot
345  return;
346  }
347 
348  // set our weapon selection to what
349  // the playerstate is currently using
350  if (!(snap->snapFlags & SNAPFLAG_NOT_ACTIVE)) {
351  CG_SetInitialSnapshot(snap);
352  }
353  }
354 
355  // loop until we either have a valid nextSnap with a serverTime
356  // greater than cg.time to interpolate towards, or we run
357  // out of available snapshots
358  do {
359  // if we don't have a nextframe, try and read a new one in
360  if (!cg.nextSnap) {
361  snap = CG_ReadNextSnapshot();
362 
363  // if we still don't have a nextframe, we will just have to
364  // extrapolate
365  if (!snap) {
366  break;
367  }
368 
369  CG_SetNextSnap(snap);
370 
371 
372  // if time went backwards, we have a level restart
373  if (cg.nextSnap->serverTime < cg.snap->serverTime) {
374  CG_Error("CG_ProcessSnapshots: Server time went backwards");
375  }
376  }
377 
378  // if our time is < nextFrame's, we have a nice interpolating state
379  if (cg.time >= cg.snap->serverTime && cg.time < cg.nextSnap->serverTime) {
380  break;
381  }
382 
383  // we have passed the transition from nextFrame to frame
384  CG_TransitionSnapshot();
385  } while (1);
386 
387  // assert our valid conditions upon exiting
388  if (cg.snap == NULL) {
389  CG_Error("CG_ProcessSnapshots: cg.snap == NULL");
390  }
391  if (cg.time < cg.snap->serverTime) {
392  // this can happen right after a vid_restart
393  cg.time = cg.snap->serverTime;
394  }
395  if (cg.nextSnap != NULL && cg.nextSnap->serverTime <= cg.time) {
396  CG_Error("CG_ProcessSnapshots: cg.nextSnap->serverTime <= cg.time");
397  }
398 
399 }

Referenced by CG_DrawActiveFrame().

251  re->shaderRGBA[3] = 255;

259

261  // nudge down a bit so it isn't exactly in center
262  re->origin[2] -= 8;
263  re->oldorigin[2] -= 8;
264  return;
265  }
266

268  VectorSubtract(end, start, vec);
269  len = VectorNormalize(vec);
270  PerpendicularVector(temp, vec);
271  for (i = 0; i < 36; i++) {
272  RotatePointAroundVector(axis[i], vec, temp, i * 10);//banshee 2.4 was 10
273  }
274 
275  VectorMA(move, 20, vec, move);
276  VectorScale(vec, SPACING, vec);
277 
278  skip = -1;
279 
280  j = 18;
281  for (i = 0; i < len; i += SPACING) {
282  if (i != skip) {
283  skip = i + SPACING;
284  le = CG_AllocLocalEntity();
285  re = &le->refEntity;
286  le->leFlags = LEF_PUFF_DONT_SCALE;
287  le->leType = LE_MOVE_SCALE_FADE;
288  le->startTime = cg.time;
289  le->endTime = cg.time + (i >> 1) + 600;
290  le->lifeRate = 1.0 / (le->endTime - le->startTime);
291 
292  re->shaderTime = cg.time / 1000.0f;
293  re->reType = RT_SPRITE;
294  re->radius = 1.1f;
295  re->customShader = cgs.media.railRingsShader;
296 
297  re->shaderRGBA[0] = ci->color2[0] * 255;
298  re->shaderRGBA[1] = ci->color2[1] * 255;
299  re->shaderRGBA[2] = ci->color2[2] * 255;
300  re->shaderRGBA[3] = 255;
301 
302  le->color[0] = ci->color2[0] * 0.75;
303  le->color[1] = ci->color2[1] * 0.75;
304  le->color[2] = ci->color2[2] * 0.75;
305  le->color[3] = 1.0f;
306 
307  le->pos.trType = TR_LINEAR;
308  le->pos.trTime = cg.time;
309 
310  VectorCopy(move, move2);
311  VectorMA(move2, RADIUS, axis[j], move2);
312  VectorCopy(move2, le->pos.trBase);
313 
314  le->pos.trDelta[0] = axis[j][0] * 6;
315  le->pos.trDelta[1] = axis[j][1] * 6;
316  le->pos.trDelta[2] = axis[j][2] * 6;
317  }

322  }
323 }

403  if (client != cg.predictedPlayerState.clientNum || cg_scorePlum.integer == 0) {
404  return;
405  }
406

409  le->leType = LE_SCOREPLUM;

411  le->endTime = cg.time + 4000;
412  le->lifeRate = 1.0 / (le->endTime - le->startTime);
413

417

421  }

◆ CG_ShaderStateChanged()

void CG_ShaderStateChanged ( void  )

Definition at line 242 of file cg_servercmds.c.

243 {
244  char originalShader[MAX_QPATH];
245  char newShader[MAX_QPATH];
246  char timeOffset[16];
247  const char* o;
248  char* n, * t;
249 
250  o = CG_ConfigString(CS_SHADERSTATE);
251  while (o && *o) {
252  n = strstr(o, "=");
253  if (n && *n) {
254  strncpy(originalShader, o, n - o);
255  originalShader[n - o] = 0;
256  n++;
257  t = strstr(n, ":");
258  if (t && *t) {
259  strncpy(newShader, n, t - n);
260  newShader[t - n] = 0;
261  } else {
262  break;
263  }
264  t++;
265  o = strstr(t, "@");
266  if (o) {
267  strncpy(timeOffset, t, o - t);
268  timeOffset[o - t] = 0;
269  o++;
270  trap_R_RemapShader(originalShader, newShader, timeOffset);
271  }
272  } else {
273  break;
274  }
275  }
276 }

502  // make sure we don't get any unwanted transition effects
503  *ops = *ps;

963  return qtrue;
964  } else if (team == TEAM_BLUE && cgs.flagStatus == FLAG_TAKEN_BLUE) {
965  return qtrue;
966  } else {
967  return qfalse;
968  }
969  } else {
970  if (team == TEAM_RED && cgs.blueflag == FLAG_TAKEN) {
971  return qtrue;
972  } else if (team == TEAM_BLUE && cgs.redflag == FLAG_TAKEN) {
973  return qtrue;
974  } else {
975  return qfalse;
976  }
977  }
978  }
979  return qfalse;
980 }

Referenced by CG_OwnerDrawVisible().

◆ trap_AddCommand()

void trap_AddCommand ( const char *  cmdName)

The string cmdName is added to a tab-completion list for the console.

Tab completion is case-insensitive, but the completed string is rewritten with the stored capitalization.

Commands added to the commands[] array are automatically addded for tab-completion by the function CG_InitConsoleCommands(), and, in fact, this is the only function that calls this trap in the baseq3 game source.

Parameters
cmdNameCommand name.

Definition at line 161 of file cg_syscalls.c.

162 {
163  syscall(CG_ADDCOMMAND, cmdName);
164 }

Referenced by CG_InitConsoleCommands().

char *  buffer,
int  bufferLength 
)

This will fill the buffer pointed to by buffer with an argument to a client command where n is the argument to return.

0 is the command itself, 1 is the first argument and so on... Very similiar to char **argv in a C program.

◆ trap_CIN_PlayCinematic()

int trap_CIN_PlayCinematic ( const char *  arg0,
int  xpos,
int  ypos,
int  width,
int  height,
int  bits 
)

This function loads up and begins playing an ROQ file at the coordinates given.

if the CIN_hold flag is specified, the ROQ is loaded in a paused state. The function returns a handle to the cinematic instance or zero on failure.

This returns a handle. arg0 is the name in the format "idlogo.roq", set arg1 to NULL, alteredstates to qfalse (do not alter gamestate)

Parameters
arg0The name of the .RoQ file to load.
xposThe X coordinate on-screen for the left edge of the cinematic display.
yposThe Y coordinate on-screen for the top edge of the cinematic display.
widthThe screen width of the cinematic display.
heightThe screen height of the cinematic display.
bitsCombinations of the following flags: CIN_system, CIN_loop, CIN_hold, CIN_silent, CIN_shader.
Returns

Definition at line 750 of file cg_syscalls.c.

751 {
752  return syscall(CG_CIN_PLAYCINEMATIC, arg0, xpos, ypos, width, height, bits);
753 }

Referenced by UI_DrawClanCinematic(), UI_DrawMapCinematic(), UI_DrawPreviewCinematic(), UI_FeederSelection(), and UI_PlayCinematic().

◆ trap_Cvar_Register()

void trap_Cvar_Register ( vmCvar_t *  cvar,
const char *  var_name,
const char *  value,
int  flags 
)

This function is used to create a new vmCvar.

It sends all the information to the engine's main database and then it stores a local copy of the data into the vmCvar_t passed as the first argument.

Parameters
cvarA pointer the location in which to store the local data.
var_nameA null-terminated string that will be used to set the vmCvar's name field.
valueA null-terminated string that will be used to set both the floating point and integer value fields of the vmCvar.
flags?.

◆ trap_Cvar_Set()

void trap_Cvar_Set ( const char *  var_name,
const char *  value 
)

This function searchs for the name of the vmCvar and stores the value into both the float and integer fields of the corresponding vmCvar entry.

The only way to effectly change the value of a vmCvar is to use this function, the ANSI storage operator only modifies the local buffer and not the "master copy".

Parameters
var_nameA null-terminated string containing the name of the vmCvar to set.
valueA null-terminated string containing the desired value.

Definition at line 72 of file cg_syscalls.c.

73 {
74  syscall(CG_CVAR_SET, var_name, value);

◆ trap_Cvar_VariableStringBuffer()

void trap_Cvar_VariableStringBuffer ( const char *  var_name,
char *  buffer,
int  bufsize 
)

This trap copies the content of a cvar named by var_name into a mod-space string.

This is useful for obtaining cvar contents that are not bound, or cannot be bound, to a vmCvar_t variable in the mod code.

The terminating NULL is attached to the end of the copied string by this trap, guaranteeing buffer holds a null-terminated string. The total number of characters copied, including terminating NULL, fits within the size specified by bufsize, truncating the string if necessary.

A nonexistent cvar provides an empty string. An existing cvar with empty content also provides an empty string. Thus, this trap is not sufficient to determine if a cvar actually exists or not.

This trap does not create a new cvar; to create a new cvar during run-time, you can use trap_Cvar_Set or trap_SendConsoleCommand.

Parameters
var_namename of cvar (console variable).
bufferdestination string buffer.
bufsizemaximum limit of string buffer.
var_name
buffer
bufsize

Definition at line 96 of file cg_syscalls.c.

97 {
98  syscall(CG_CVAR_VARIABLESTRINGBUFFER, var_name, buffer, bufsize);
99 }

Referenced by _UI_Init(), _UI_SetActiveMenu(), ArenaServers_LoadFavorites(), ArenaServers_SetType(), ArenaServers_StartRefresh(), BotInitLibrary(), BotReadSessionData(), CG_DrawCrosshair3D(), CG_DrawInformation(), CG_NewClientInfo(), CG_RegisterCvars(), CG_StartOrbit_f(), Cmd_CallVote_f(), Controls_DrawPlayer(), Controls_MenuInit(), ExitLevel(), Favorites_Add(), G_InitWorldSession(), G_RankGameOver(), G_ReadSessionData(), GraphicsOptions_GetResolutions(), GraphicsOptions_SetMenuItems(), PlayerModel_SetMenuItems(), PlayerSettings_DrawPlayer(), ServerOptions_InitPlayerItems(), SpecifyLeague_GetList(), trap_Cvar_VariableValue(), UI_BuildFindPlayerList(), UI_BuildServerDisplayList(), UI_CanShowTierVideo(), UI_Cvar_VariableString(), UI_DrawConnectScreen(), UI_GetAwardLevel(), UI_GetBestScore(), UI_LogAwardData(), UI_MainMenu(), UI_NetSource_HandleKey(), UI_SetBestScore(), UI_ShowTierVideo(), UI_SPLevelMenu_Init(), UI_SPLevelMenu_MenuDraw(), UI_SPUnlock_f(), and UI_SPUnlockMedals_f().

This is very similar to the trap_Print function with the exception that this will halt execution of the module it is called from.

◆ trap_FS_FOpenFile()

int trap_FS_FOpenFile ( const char *  qpath,
fileHandle_t *  f,
fsMode_t  mode 
)

This opens a file specified by the string qpath and allocates a fileHandle_t (just a typedef int) to that file.

This is then used in subsequent operations involving the file. The fsMode_t enumeration refers to the mode the file is opened in. FS_READ for reading the file. FS_WRITE will create the file qpath if it doesn't exist or 0 length it if it does. FS_APPEND allows writing to the end of an existing file. FS_APPEND_SYNC is similar to FS_APPEND except you can read from the file at the same time.

An int is returned representing the length of the file being opened.

Parameters
qpathThe file to be opened.
fReference to a local fileHandle_t.
modeMode to open the file in.
Returns

Definition at line 116 of file cg_syscalls.c.

117 {
118  return syscall(CG_FS_FOPENFILE, qpath, f, mode);
119 }

Referenced by CG_FileExists(), CG_ParseAnimationFile(), G_InitGame(), G_LoadArenasFromFile(), G_LoadBotsFromFile(), GetMenuBuffer(), UI_CalcPostGameStats(), UI_ClearScores(), UI_FileExists(), UI_hasSkinForBase(), UI_LoadArenasFromFile(), UI_LoadBestScores(), UI_LoadBotsFromFile(), and UI_ParseAnimationFile().

◆ trap_GetEntityToken()

qboolean trap_GetEntityToken ( char *  buffer,
int  bufferSize 
)

This call fills the buffer pointed to by buffer with all the key/value pairs of every map entity.

The string returned has a very similar format to that of the tail end of a GTKRadiant .map file before it is compiled to a bsp. It is unlikely that a user would ever need to call this since it is handled already in g_spawn.c.

bufferSizeThe size of the buffer.

Bitmask values are: KEYCATCH_CONSOLE KEYCATCH_UI KEYCATCH_MESSAGE KEYCATCH_CGAME

(see also trap_Key_SetCatcher())

To check if CGAME key-catching is active: if (trap_Key_GetCatcher() & KEYCATCH_UI) { //happy happy }

◆ trap_Key_IsDown()

qboolean trap_Key_IsDown ( int  keynum)

Returns true is the indicated key is held down, returns false if not held down (released).

The values of keynum range from 0 to 255, inclusive. For the most part, a key's keynum corresponds to its character's ASCII value (e.g. the 'A' key is 65).

I have a list of keynames used by the bind command with their keynums which I may append at a later date. In the meantime, if you want to know them now, you can do this:

Create a keynums.cfg with a pattern like: bind 0x00 Key 0x00 bind 0x01 Key 0x01 ... bind 0xfe Key 0xfe bind 0xff Key 0xff (case matters for the hex values, and a scripting language to automate this really helps).

Back up your q3config.cfg, run Q3, "/exec keynums.cfg; bindlist; condump keynums.txt; quit".

In the file "keynums.txt" you should now have lines like: UPARROW "Key 0x84"

There's your keynum list.

(Generating keynums.cfg in GNU bash: for i in $(seq 0 255); do x=$(printf "%02x" $i); echo bind 0x$x Key 0x$x; done > keynums.cfg).

Parameters
keynumA key keynum.
Returns

Definition at line 592 of file cg_syscalls.c.

593 {
594  return syscall(CG_KEY_ISDOWN, keynum);
595 }

Referenced by MField_KeyDownEvent().

◆ trap_Key_SetCatcher()

void trap_Key_SetCatcher ( int  catcher)

Redirects key events to different module(s).

Normally, key events are interpreted by the engine, affected by the key bindings. This trap allows you redirect key events to other components.

Valid catchers are: KEYCATCH_CONSOLE: the console KEYCATCH_UI: the ui module KEYCATCH_MESSAGE: the little message editor thingy KEYCATCH_CGAME: the cgame module

These are bitmasked values, meaning you can combine them with the OR operator (|), as in (KEYCATCH_UI|KEYCATCH_CGAME), but I recommend against trying multiple catchers (it may get confusing).

As a mods programmer, you may be most interested in KEYCATCH_CGAME, and on this I will concentrate this entry.

— The Keyboard —

When key-catching is enabled (trap_Key_SetCatcher(KEYCATCH_CGAME);), upon a change in key state (gets pressed or gets released), the engine calls the vmMain() function in cg_main.c with the following parameters: command = CG_KEY_EVENT arg0 = keynum arg1 = 1 if pressed, 0 if released.

In baseq3 game source, this event is already handled and delegated to CG_KeyEvent(), which is empty.

The values for keynum are the same as for trap_Key_IsDown().

Key catching is disabled by calling with a parameter of 0 (as in, no catchers). Key catching is also terminated if the user presses the ESC key, which means you won't receive events on the ESC key.

— The Mouse —

When key-catching is enabled, mouse movement is also redirected to the specified module. When the engine detects mouse movement, it calls vmMain() with the following parameters: command = CG_MOUSE_EVENT arg0 = relative X position arg1 = relative Y position

The game source for baseq3 delegates this event to CG_MouseEvent().

Pointer Device Movement - Reported Value: Left - Negative X Right - Positive X Up - Negative Y Down - Positive Y

The engine only reports mouse movement – if the mouse doesn't move, there is no mouse event. The engine reports mouse buttons and wheels (if any) as key events, for binding purposes.

Cvars do not influence the reported values.

Parameters
catcherKey catchers bitmask.

Definition at line 677 of file cg_syscalls.c.

678 {
679  syscall(CG_KEY_SETCATCHER, catcher);
680 }

Referenced by _UI_KeyEvent(), _UI_SetActiveMenu(), CG_KeyEvent(), CG_MouseEvent(), UI_ForceMenuOff(), UI_MainMenu(), UI_Pause(), UI_PushMenu(), UI_RunMenuScript(), UI_SPLevelMenu_f(), and UI_SPPostgameMenu_f().

◆ trap_R_AddLightToScene()

void trap_R_AddLightToScene ( const vec3_t  org,
float  intensity,
float  r,
float  g,
float  b 
)

This function will add a light to the game at org, which has a radius of intensity units, and the colour data which is shown in the variables r, g, and b.

The highest number for an RGB index is 255, but in Quake 3 the colour's index is divided by 255 to give a normalized value.

Say I want to make a purple light. The colour data for purple in RGB is 255,0,255. So the normalized values for this colour are:

255/255 = 1.0 0/255 = 0.0 255/255 = 1.0

o to add a purple light at the vector x, and radius 2.4 I would write:

trap_R_AddLightToScene( x, 2.4, 1.0, 0.0, 1.0 );.

Parameters
orgorigin of the light - where the light will be.
intensitynot the exact intensity of the light, but the radius of the light - the light is a sphere-like object and points within that object are lighted up, and the closer something is to the origin of the light (org) the closer the light will be to the actual colour data of the light.
rthis is the colour data of the light (normalized, so the highest value, 255, is 1.0) - r is the amount of red light.
ggreen light.
bblue light.

Definition at line 465 of file cg_syscalls.c.

466 {
467  syscall(CG_R_ADDLIGHTTOSCENE, org, PASSFLOAT(intensity), PASSFLOAT(r), PASSFLOAT(g), PASSFLOAT(b));
468 }

Referenced by CG_AddExplosion(), CG_AddPlayerWeapon(), CG_AddSpriteExplosion(), CG_EntityEffects(), CG_Missile(), CG_PlayerPowerups(), and UI_DrawPlayer().

◆ trap_SendClientCommand()

void trap_SendClientCommand ( const char *  s)

Sends command string as a client command directly to server.

In contrast, trap_SendConsoleCommand() sends the string to the local console first, and, if not recognized there, sends to the server as a client command.

This trap makes no distinction among EXEC_NOW, EXEC_INSERT, or EXEC_APPEND as with trap_SendConsoleCommand(), since the command is sent "somewhere else".

The set of "client commands" is separate from "console commands", so that a misbehaving client cannot kill a server by attempting to send "quit" as a command.

In baseq3, the common SendClientCommand commands are "score" (to obtain information for scoreboard), "tell" (chat, commands), and "vtell" (Q3TA chat with WAV playback).

Beware of the server cvar sv_floodProtect. With it set to 1 (the default), commands sent to the server using SendClientCommand in rapid succession will be silently dropped by the server. In the case where some critical client->server communication is implemented using SendClientCommand, it is important that sv_floodProtect is off.

Note that chat flood protection can be fairly trivially implemented in the game module.

Parameters
sCommand string.

Definition at line 205 of file cg_syscalls.c.

206 {
207  syscall(CG_SENDCLIENTCOMMAND, s);
208 }

Referenced by CG_DrawTourneyScoreboard(), CG_ScoresDown_f(), CG_TargetCommand_f(), CG_TellAttacker_f(), and CG_TellTarget_f().

◆ trap_SendConsoleCommand()

void trap_SendConsoleCommand ( const char *  text)

The string provided by text is run as if typed as a command into the console.

A leading slash (/) is not required.

Parameters
textThe command to be executed.

148  syscall(CG_SENDCONSOLECOMMAND, text);

545 }

Referenced by CG_DrawActiveFrame().

◆ trap_SnapVector()

void trap_SnapVector ( float *  v)

This simply removes the fractional part of each axis of v - a form of "snap to grid".

Its purpose is to save network bandwidth by exploiting the fact that delta compression will only transmit the changes in state of a struct. A changing vector will change less frequently if only the integral part is taken into account.

Parameters
vVector to snap.

Definition at line 730 of file cg_syscalls.c.

731 {
732  syscall(CG_SNAPVECTOR, v);
733 }

◆ trap_startCamera()

void trap_startCamera ( int  time)

◆ trap_UpdateScreen()

void trap_UpdateScreen ( void  )

trap_UpdateScreen updates the screen.

cg_local.h says: // force a screen update, only used during gamestate load void trap_UpdateScreen( void );

the Trap_UpdateScreen itself appears to be: cg_syscalls.c void trap_UpdateScreen( void ) { syscall( CG_UPDATESCREEN ); }

This is also called by: UI_Atoms.C

void UI_UpdateScreen( void ) { trap_UpdateScreen(); }

it is also called by: ui_local.h void trap_R_DrawStretchPic(float x, float y, float w, float h, float s1, float t1, float s2, float t2, qhandle_t hShader); void trap_UpdateScreen( void ); int trap_CM_LerpTag(orientation_t *tag, clipHandle_t mod, int startFrame, int endFrame, float frac, const char *tagName);

The locations of the calls and the remarks placed around it imply that this trap is ONLY for updating the screen during connection to local or remote host.

(eg: Loading....shotgun ; Loading.... Gauntlet ect... during the load of a map.)

Definition at line 243 of file cg_syscalls.c.

244 {
245  syscall(CG_UPDATESCREEN);
246 }

Referenced by CG_LoadingString(), and UI_UpdateScreen().
